item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:9, topic:395188”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=492378.msg3600365#msg3600365 date=1305498764]

PHP provides a function called ctype_alnum, it takes a string and returns true if it contains only A-Z, a-z, 0-9.

so u could use ajax(a simple example http://www.w3schools.com/php/php_ajax_php.asp like some websites do when they check if the username already exists except check if its just alphanumeric onblur(element loses focus)
[/quote]There is absolutely no reason to be loading an entire other page just to check for this. It’s a complete waste of time better done in JavaScript. JavaScript can’t check databases; that’s the only reason AJAX is used for verifying that a username isn’t already taken.

Actually it does. How else would it check? AJAX is simply just an HTTP request through Javascript, nothing special.

PS: AJAX is Javascript people.[/quote]Yes, it’s JavaScript. But, it’s JavaScript that relies on setting up a connection to another page; as you said, an HTTP request. Why would you ask the server to do something, which takes exponentially more time, when it can be done just as easily with the client?
